nodes.text: Video leaked of a @CBCNews reporter chuckling with an RCMP officer about “brutalizing innocent children” at the fairy creek blockades. This is Canadian news bias when it comes to Indigenous youth defending old growth forest. https://t.co/YCwRk06rHQ
@siiamhamilton @CBCNews Disgusting.

@siiamhamilton @CBCNews THIS explains why @CBCNews
 vilifies #Indigenous #LandDefenders & valorizes the #RCMP thugs who deny their rights. Then they call it "balanced reporting".  
I call it #SystemicRacism". 
Respect #IndigenousRights  #LandBack
@siiamhamilton @theserfstv @CBCNews Didn't realize Canada was also this fucked up

@siiamhamilton @theserfstv @CBCNews I used to think Canada was like the USA, but less terrible. I now realize that while they're better in some ways, they're worse in others and roughly the same in plenty more.

@siiamhamilton And we're supposed to trust vaccines distributed, advertised and made to take by the likes of people like these. I've already learned of how pointless this vaccine is but they don't advertise the sorry success rates or all health consequences in full detail=Unjust control attempt
@CamDeBaets @siiamhamilton What a bunch of nonsense, this thread doesn't even have anything to do with vaccines🤡
@siiamhamilton @CBCNews Shame on you CBC
@siiamhamilton @CBCNews https://t.co/gb7EzPL2ld

The ability to joke about violence towards innocent children works towards dismissing the very real violence that is currently taking place. In doing this, the reporter is normalizing ongoing everyday police violence that disproportionately affects Indigenous youth.
@siiamhamilton Terrible! Cc @Puglaas
@siiamhamilton @CBCNews I spoke with someone named Audrey and they told me to email cbcvancouvercommunications@cbc.ca about this. It might be worth emailing them too!

@CharlieBro1984 @TraceyCapes @siiamhamilton @CBCNews Yes, Charlie I’ve watched the video. And I’ve watched the RCMP laugh along to the remark of “brutalizing innocent children”. Pardon me if I don’t find it remotely funny. Especially with how folx were treated on site.
@siiamhamilton @CBCNews He could have been chatting up the RCMP for easy access rather than laughing with them.  Everything in context we don't know ..

@TraceyCapes @siiamhamilton @CBCNews And as none of YOUR CHILDREN were being joked about it’s so much easier for you to defend him than it is for me\n\nTry being the parent of a beaten Indigenous child and see if you go in to bat for him
@SmithSnark @olBoozy @siiamhamilton @JesseBrown @CBCNews Honesty is always a Brent thing.
@brent2501 @olBoozy @siiamhamilton @JesseBrown @CBCNews I think you're confusing stupidity with honesty.

Some people need to take a look at their behaviour (that does not condone the dispicable behaviour of the Saskatoon officers doing starlight tours, or other abuses)

@siiamhamilton @CBCNews Note that this was a freelancer who won't be hired again, and that freelancers are used as a direct result of deep and sustained cuts and changes to the public broadcaster's infrastructure. The cuts reduce the quality. Low quality reduces support. And we lose our CBC ...and then?
@siiamhamilton @CBCNews (And yes, obvs the main point is: this person is vile slime.)

@TraceyCapes @siiamhamilton @CBCNews ... I’m not even sure where to start unpacking that; however, regardless of “why” it’s still absolutely unacceptable.  In my honest opinion the RCMP officers should also be reprimanded.  Enough is enough.

@siiamhamilton @Ruth_HHopkins @CBCNews Rarely happening in the obverse colonization perpetrated by one group against others still occurs around the globe. This example is made more difficult after a US/Trump change in policy. @SecBlinken has his work cut out for him. \nhttps://t.co/KnG04OCCc1
@siiamhamilton @Ruth_HHopkins @CBCNews @SecBlinken 60,000 Americans live here. \nhttps://t.co/utH3e0Z0Xk

@siiamhamilton @Ruth_HHopkins @CBCNews col·o·ni·za·tion
/kälənəˈzāSH(ə)n/
noun
1. the action or process of settling among and establishing control over the indigenous people of an area.
“It wasn’t hard to believe because colonization is a culture.”

@siiamhamilton @CBCNews @BradMacNews why were you joking with RCMP about brutalizing innocent people? How are people expected to feel safe while you are around reporting? How does this make you fit to report on what’s taking place? #FairyCreek #accountability

@Skeena69 @siiamhamilton @CBCNews No, the cbc could be an amazing service used to unite Canadians rather than divide us. Replace the top management with people who have some dignity and are capable of understanding why supporting genocide of Indiginous people, in Canada and around the world is disgusting.

@Ykjdmm @Skeena69 @siiamhamilton @CBCNews Wishful thinking. \nBetter to follow the Dutch broadcasting model with independent broadcasting societies broadcasting within a public system. It provides for variety in colours of opinion, all kinds of political few points, arts, culture, alternative voices etc.

@SacrificeSoft @siiamhamilton @JesseBrown @CBCNews @cbcnewsbc For anybody who decides to do some searching, look for:

Nose shape
Hair part direction
Chin shape

Those are the 3 most prominent features in this video.

If you wanna go deep? Listen to the voice and compare to some interviews.

@Skeena69 @siiamhamilton @CBCNews Conservative fascists agree with you 100%
@siiamhamilton @anotheramyfung @CBCNews WTF is wrong with people.

@TraceyCapes @siiamhamilton @CBCNews So it’s appropriate to joke about brutalizing children in order to have “easy access”? Hmm...

@linneajericho @TraceyCapes @siiamhamilton @CBCNews Pretending to laugh along with a cruel joke at the expense of a vulnerable group would be very different from what this person did, which was actively making the joke in the first place.

@siiamhamilton @Tzeporah @CBCNews Nothing is amusing about bullying Indigenous children. Read King George III Royal Proclamation Act. His relative were in partnership with my Montreal NW Co &  Pacific Coastal merchant trading family in a silver mine on Lake Superior two Centuries ago. We  explored this land.

@siiamhamilton @Tzeporah @CBCNews Did any 1 get the cop's badge no. & reporter's credentials? I do not like hearing indigenous youth getting bullied. There is an act called the Royal Proclamation. They should refresh their memories. My ancestors were in business with King George III relative Prince  Wm. Henry.
@siiamhamilton @SacrificeSoft @JesseBrown @CBCNews @cbcnewsbc Unfortunately I don't have as much time as I'd like to try and generate list lol
@siiamhamilton @CBCNews The culture at CBC seems really bad. Biased reporting against Palestine showing favouritism for Israel... Then censoring the journalists who just want honesty and integrity.
@siiamhamilton @CBCNews That's absolutely disgusting! Thank goodness you were able to capture and expose this disgusting behaviour!

@siiamhamilton @Irngutaq2 @CBCNews yea  i been saying that for few years now. our main news is corrupt . i had a firat nation person that works for cbc tell me  that cbc is good because they hire some first nations . i didnt even bother to debate cause i knew it was hopeless.

Regarding a video circulating on social media at the Fairy Creek blockade and RCMP arrests in B.C., CBC confirms the person in the video is a freelancer hired by us. We will not engage his services in the future.  (1/2)
